title: My Portfolio
brief: My protfolio website written in Twitter Bootstrap and jQuery.
description: This website serves as my self-introduction to other people. It can be viewed on desktop, tablet or mobile devices. I also abstract project listings and descriptions into JSON files so that I can update the site easily in the future.
points: Use Twitter Bootstrap for responsive web design
Save project descriptions and links in JSON, and retrive them via jQuery AJAX methods when user clicks the project detail link

title: Small widgets
brief: Some web pages for practicing HTML5/CSS3/javascript and jQuery.
description: Some web pages for practicing HTML5, CSS3 and javascript, including multiple versions of analog clock and star rating.
points: drawed an analog clock with pure DOM elements and css
designed a calculator without using "eval()" method

title: A Fast Solution for Network Design
brief: Implemented an algorithm covered in class, and generated graphs by using python-igraph.
description: A linear programming algorithm in order to find a network design that has the minimal cost in a given network graph.
points: Implemented Dijkstra's algorithm in Java to find shortest path between two nodes in a graph
Generated graphs for project report by using a graph generating library python-igraph

title: (Team Project) SIP User Agent Remote Controller
description: A Java Applet that can remotely control a SIP User Agent over the network to make a call or receive a call.
points: Created a message-oriented protocol between a Java Applet and a Java program.
Modified Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) to meet project requirements.
Investigated an open source Java package (MjSip)

screenshots.caption: http messages between Http server on Sip user agent and web browser
message protocol for calling from web browser
message protocol for calling from another Sip user agent
message protocol for closing a call
A sip user agent written in Java Swing and MjSip
Java Applet for users to remote control their sip user agent

title: (Team) Distributed Mutual Exclusion Algorithm
description: A quorum-based and token-based mutual exclusion algorithm in a distributed system.
points: Applied TCP Socket programming in C on Linux
Practiced Linux commands and tools
Used JIRA for project management

screenshots.caption: our algorithm's performance compare to Maekawa's algorithm

title: JTChat
brief: An IRC client written in Java Swing
description: An Internet Relay Chat (IRC) program designed for users of a popular video streaming website, Twitch.tv.
points: Implemented a simple IRC bot by Java TCP socket packages.
Learned to write a GUI program with JAVA Swing.
Analyzed and handled customized IRC control messages made by Twitch.

screenshots.caption: simulate "delete banned messages" functionality on Twitch.tv
has ability to parse Twitch-customized messages and display nickname colors

title: Block Attack
description: A mini game written in python and pygame
points: (Use arrow keys to control)
(Game objective: do not get crushed by those blocks!)

title: (Team) Insurance Management Database System
description: A relational database for Insurance companies and agencies.
points: Designed an enhanced entity-relationship (EER) model from requirement documents.
Converted the EER model to a relational model.
Performed SQL queries with Oracle SQLPlus on a Unix machine.
